page.title: 01GAZETTER
page.content: The landscape is flat with trees and generally quite large fields separated by hedges. It is good quality farmland with scattered arable and mixed arable farms. The two small communities Spooner Row (said to have got its name from the Tudor wood-turning industry) and Suton are interdependent. They have several businesses to do with agriculture. The A11 trunk road between Norwich and London passes through the area, our section being part of the first turnpike road in the country. Greatly increased traffic due to trade with the EEC countries and the oil and gas industry has put pressure on the route and it has been recently improved. The main railway line from Norwich to Peterborough, Cambridge and Birmingham also passes through the area.
